intro: Seddera ogadenensis, commonly known as the Ogaden seddera, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Seddera ogadenensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals.
